page.title: 14ASHLEY VILLAGE:A DESCRIPTION
page.content: Ashley village is on the extreme south of the Survey area and is a peculiar yet interesting collection of buildings without centre or unity; apart from the crossroad and community spirit. There are two small, recent, housing developments and apart from cricket ground, railway and farms the principal features are: {SCHOOL.}l864. Somewhat isolated from the village and faced with closure. {PUBLIC HOUSE.}The Greyhound.Converted building as is barn/house opposite. {SMITHY GARAGE.}Includes showroom. petrol, service bays & local men. {POLICE STATION.}One police man who lives in police house in the village. {POST OFFICE/SHOP.}Very small building, part of a row of original cottages. {CHURCH. }St.Elizabeth. Established as other C.of E. churches over populated. {NO PRESSURE FROM URBAN DEVELOPMENT.
